summary.para: Describes changes in the reference pictures as memory operations as a tuple of an operation identifier and associated parameters needed for the operation.

remarks.para: For more information, refer to H264 specification for more details: section 8.2.5.4 "Adaptive memory control decoded reference picture marking process".
The variable MaxLongTermFrameIdx is derived as follows:

– If max_long_term_frame_idx_plus1 is equal to 0, MaxLongTermFrameIdx is set equal to "no long-term frame indices". – Otherwise (max_long_term_frame_idx_plus1 is greater than 0), MaxLongTermFrameIdx is set equal to max_long_term_frame_idx_plus1 − 1.

The operation of marking the current frame as a short-term reference is given by a flag present in the structure with its corresponding PictureOrderCountNumber and FrameDecodingOrderNumber values indicated in the associated picture control structure.
The variable max_num_ref_frames is indicated in this API by the maximum DPB capacity reported.

Note that for marking an IDR frame as long-term reference, the proposed explicit mechanism is to mark it as short term reference first, by setting when calling for the IDR frame, and later promoting it to be a long-term reference frame using memory management operation '3' to mark a short-term reference picture as "used for long-term reference" and assign a long-term frame index to it.

Alternatively, if encoding an IDR frame and setting adaptive_ref_pic_marking_mode_flag = 1, the driver will assume that the client is attempting to set the H264 slice header long_term_reference_flag and will do so in the output bitstream for the EncodeFrame call.

summary.para: The control operation to be applied to affect the reference picture marking state.
Used with memory_management_control_operation equal to 3 or 1 to assign a long-term frame index to a short-term reference picture or to mark a short-term reference picture as "unused for reference".
Used with memory_management_control_operation equal to 2 to mark a long-term reference picture as "unused for reference".
Used with memory_management_control_operation equal to 3 or 6 to assign a long-term frame index to a picture.
The value minus 1 specifies the maximum value of long-term frame index allowed for long-term reference pictures (until receipt of another value of max_long_term_frame_idx_plus1).
